BOMBA options
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher DS Archive (DS): Japanese DS Games Archive: Monster Farm DS: Misc. Q&A (post all new topics here, we'll make more sections later): BOMBA options
By Thorr on Thursday, October 4, 2007 - 08:21 am:

The BOMBA building in town has 3 options under it.
The first one is training (the board games).
The second one is Venturing.
The third one says No Ra Mo N in katakana, which I can't seem to wrap my mind around. What exactly does this option do??? I dared to try it and got nothing but dialogue.

By Thorr on Thursday, October 4, 2007 - 08:34 am:

If I look at this, then Nora and Mon could be a contraction meant to imply Stray Monster, but does this option let you fight a stray monster?

By GM on Thursday, October 4, 2007 - 08:57 am:

They're marks. Wanted monsters.

Basically, you pick one you want to hunt, and during either Errantry
or Venture, you'll encounter them every now and then. Rulilu will
exclaim when you face one.

If you beat it, you'll get a bounty.

By Thorr on Thursday, October 4, 2007 - 08:58 am:

Ahh, excellent. Sounds like a neat sidequest.
